member.summary: An event that is raised when the command generates output. The output is provided as a byte blob without encoding.

member.summary: An event that is raised when the state of the command changes on a node.

member.summary: Cancels the command.

member.summary: Runs the command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.IRemoteCommand.StartWithCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs the command using the specified credentials.
member.param: The name of the RunAs user, in the form domain\username. The user name is limited to 80 characters. If this parameter is NULL, the method uses the owner of the job. If this parameter is an empty string, the service searches the credentials cache for the credentials to use. If the cache contains the credentials for a single user, those credentials are used. However, if multiple credentials exist in the cache, the user is prompted for the credentials.

The password for the RunAs user. The password is limited to 127 characters.If this parameter is null or empty, the method uses the cached password if cached; otherwise, the user is prompted for the password.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.IRemoteCommand.ProxyTaskId
member.summary: Retrieves the unique task identifier for the proxy task in a remote command job. The proxy task is the task that forwards the output and error streams from all of the nodes in a remote command to the client.
member.returns: An object that specifies the unique task identifier for the proxy task in a remote command job.

member.summary: Cancels the specified job and provides a message to the user that explains why you canceled the job.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.IScheduler.CancelJob(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cancels the specified job and provides a message to the user that explains why you canceled the job, and optionally forces the job to stop immediately. When you force the job to stop immediately, this method ignores the grace period for canceling the tasks in the job, and does not run the node release task for the job.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.RemoteCommand.StartWithCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs the command using the specified credentials.
member.param: The name of the RunAs user, in the form domain\username. The user name is limited to 80 characters.If this parameter is null, empty, or not valid, the service searches the credential cache for the credentials to use. If the cache contains the credentials for a single user, those credentials are used. However, if multiple credentials exist in the cache, the user is prompted for the credentials.

The password for the RunAs user. The password is limited to 127 characters.If this parameter is null or empty, the method uses the cached password if cached; otherwise, the user is prompted for the password.

member.returns: The identifier that uniquely identifies the command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.Scheduler.SubmitJob(Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.ISchedulerJob,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a job to the scheduling queue using the job interface to identify the job.
member.param: An interface that identifies the job to submit to the scheduling queue.

The name of the RunAs user, in the form domain\username. The user name is limited to 80 characters.If this parameter is null, empty, or not valid, the service searches the credential cache for the credentials to use. If the cache contains the credentials for a single user, those credentials are used. However, if multiple credentials exist in the cache, the user is prompted for the credentials.

The password for the RunAs user. The password is limited to 127 characters.If this parameter is null or empty, the method uses the cached password if cached; otherwise, the user is prompted for the password.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.Scheduler.SubmitJobById(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the job to the scheduling queue using the job identifier to identify the job.
member.param: An identifier that uniquely identifies the job in the cluster to add to the scheduling queue.

The name of the RunAs user, in the form domain\username. The user name is limited to 80 characters.If this parameter is null, empty, or not valid, the service searches the credential cache for the credentials to use. If the cache contains the credentials for a single user, those credentials are used. However, if multiple credentials exist in the cache, the user is prompted for the credentials.

The password for the RunAs user. The password is limited to 127 characters.If this parameter is null or empty, the method uses the cached password if cached; otherwise, the user is prompted for the password.
